sentences.english: Plz introduce Us3 to chinese folks.
sentences.chinese: 请向中国的歌迷介绍一下Us3。

sentences.english: I will sing concerts at some of my fans really want to listen to the song.
sentences.chinese: 我将在演唱会上唱一些我的歌迷真正想听的歌。

sentences.english: NIN fans can still grab The Slip for free from his web site.
sentences.chinese: MIN的歌迷同样可以从他的网站免费下载。

sentences.english: Eric had the luck to have close body contact with his female fans when they were playing games.
sentences.chinese: 孙耀威与女歌迷玩游戏时又搭膊头又揽腰，艳福不浅。

sentences.english: As expected, Pres Chou's fans gave raving reviews to the new song.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此周董歌迷依然给予高度好评。

sentences.english: Some fans in China relish how the album discomfits the establishment.
sentences.chinese: 一些中国歌迷纷纷谈到这张专辑为何会引起风波。

sentences.english: He did so much for his fans," Powell said.
sentences.chinese: 他生前为他的歌迷做了太多的事。

sentences.english: He is a die-hard fan of Madonna.
sentences.chinese: 他是玛丹娜的死忠歌迷。

sentences.english: Kiki says, "Some fans share with me serious problems they cannot tell their parents."
sentences.chinese: 有些歌迷会和我分享一些不能告诉他们父母的心事。

sentences.english: But I am also a fan of pop music, especially English songs.
sentences.chinese: 但我也是一个流行音乐的歌迷，特别是英文歌曲。

sentences.english: Zhang Jie is a song fan and he is fond of Zhou Jielun.
sentences.chinese: 张杰是个歌迷，特殊喜欢歌星周杰伦。

sentences.english: The Irish can expect a fantastic show.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰歌迷会看到一场精彩的表演。

sentences.english: Fans loved Duff's clean cut, teen-friendly image.
sentences.chinese: 歌迷们喜欢达芙清新健康的亲和形象。

sentences.english: Like other fans she would be cuing up to meet him.
sentences.chinese: 像其他歌迷她希望可以提供机会与他会面。

sentences.english: He waved good-bye to fans and left the concert hall through the back exit.
sentences.chinese: 他和歌迷们摆手再见，从后门出去了。

sentences.english: Some Jackson fans shouted "murderer" as Murray entered the courthouse.
sentences.chinese: 穆瑞走进法庭时一些杰克逊的歌迷大叫“谋杀”。

definition: bean vermicelli/mung bean starch noodles/Chinese vermicelli/cellophane noodles/CL:把[ba3]/fan (loanword)/enthusiast for sb or sth
A-Mei, aka Gulilai Amit (1972-), aboriginal Taiwanese pop singer
(of a singer) autograph session/record signing event
Eason Chan (1974-), Hong Kong pop singer and actor
Sandy Lam (1966-), Hong Kong pop singer
Jacky Cheung or Hok Yau Jacky (1961-), Cantopop and film star
Cui Jian (1961-), father of Chinese rock music
